title: Agentic Operating Model
summary: Only 11% of organizations have agentic AI in production—success requires process redesign, workforce change management, and governance-as-enabler

content.whatItIs: Deloitte's research on agentic AI adoption reveals a stark gap: while 30% explore and 38% pilot, only 14% have solutions ready to deploy and a mere 11% are actively using these systems in production.
howItWorks: Key insight: Leading enterprises don't layer agents onto existing workflows—they redesign processes to leverage agents' unique strengths
'Bolting AI onto existing workflows delivers limited value. Real impact requires reimagining processes with agents at the core.'
New paradigm: 'What if we rebuild our entire operating model around AI?' Not implementing tools—pioneering new operating models around autonomous decision-making
Workforce shift: Human-agent collaboration moving from hands-on execution to supervision and exception handling
Infrastructure requirement: Clean, consistent, real-time data, standardized interfaces, event-driven architectures
content.coreInsight: The 11% production deployment rate reveals the real barrier: organizational capacity, not technology. Success requires process redesign (not overlay), explicit workforce change management, infrastructure modernization, and governance-as-enabler. The question isn't 'how do we use AI?' but 'how do we rebuild around AI?'
content.keyMetrics: 30% exploring, 38% piloting, 14% ready to deploy, 11% in production. Governance-as-enabler increases confidence for higher-value scenarios.
